title: I pray Harry Dunn's family can find peace
text:
On August 27, Anne Sacoolas drove out of RAF Croughton and turned onto the B4031. Instead of entering the left-hand lane, the American diplomat’s wife forgot where she was and instinctively chose the right side of the road. Coming towards her was a beam of light. It was the front lamp on a motorbike ridden by 19-year-old Harry Dunn. The collision between the two vehicles was so violent, it caused a fireball.

Mrs Sacoolas is said to have run over to the stricken Harry and told him that she would get help. She then flagged down a passing motorist before returning to her car to comfort her children. What did Mrs Sacoolas say to the young man as he lay dying?

Harry’s parents would really like to...
